DOCNAME: KOŘÍNEK and OTHERS v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON , born in DATE , FAC , born in DATE , Mr PERSON , born in DATE , Mr PERSON , born in DATE , Mr PERSON born in DATE , and PERSON , born in DATE , are NORP nationals , and live in PERSON , except for PERSON who lives in PERSON Ohří . They are represented before the ORG by Mr V. Petru , a lawyer practising in GPE CARDINAL .

The applicant 's lawyer informed the ORG , by letter of DATE , that the first applicant had died on DATE . The lawyer did not specify whether legal successors wished to pursue the proceedings . However , the other applicants , members of the same family , requested an increase in any award of just satisfaction as a result of the first applicant 's death . The ORG interprets the latter as a request to continue the proceedings in respect of the first applicant .
I. The proceedings for compensation for the third applicant 's persecution during the former communist regime .
On DATE the third applicant received compensation under LAW No . TIME for his unlawful conviction and detention during the former communist regime .

On DATE ORG ( okresní soud ) rejected the third applicant 's civil action of DATE against the ORG , claiming damages for moral injury allegedly caused by his conviction , detention and the delayed removal of his conviction from the criminal records .

On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) quashed this judgment and returned it to ORG , which on DATE again dismissed the third applicant 's action , holding that there was no causal link between the alleged moral injury and his conviction , or the delayed amendment to the criminal records .
On DATE ORG upheld this judgment .
On DATE ORG ( GPE PERSON ) dismissed the third applicant 's constitutional appeal .

On DATE the third applicant lodged application no . CARDINAL with the former ORG , in which he complained under Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Convention about inadequate compensation for his persecution during the former communist regime . He also complained that the court proceedings were unfair . On DATE this application was dismissed by a ORG of CARDINAL members of the Commission as being manifestly ill - founded . ORG
II . The proceedings for damages caused by a violation of the applicants ' personal rights and by an unlawful court decision .
On DATE the applicants lodged a claim with ORG ( okresní soud ) for damages caused by a violation of their personal rights and an unlawful court decision .

On DATE ORG referred the matter to ORG ( městský soud ) , which on DATE separated that part of the action relating to the damage caused by a violation of personal rights , which it transferred to ORG ( krajský soud ) .
On DATE ORG heard the applicants , except for the sixth applicant who was to be heard by FAC ( okresní soud ) .

On DATE the applicants specified their claims for damages caused by a violation of their personal rights , which ORG subsequently separated into several proceedings , in order to deal with the individual claims of each applicant .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the president of ORG apologized for delays in the proceedings , in response to the applicants ' complaints of DATE and DATE .

On DATE the applicants specified their action lodged with ORG . However , that court interpreted this as a withdrawal of the claims of the third , fourth , fifth and sixth applicants , and so it discontinued the proceedings in respect of these claims on DATE .
On DATE ORG requested the first and second applicants to specify their action .
On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings in respect of the claims of the first and second applicants for their failure to specify the action .
In the meantime , on DATE ORG had held a hearing in respect of the claims for damages relating to a violation of the applicants ' personal rights .
On DATE it found that a part of the action , which had been transferred to it by ORG , related to an unlawful court decision and therefore separated this part of the action from other proceedings .
On DATE it requested the applicants to specify their actions for the protection of personal rights and to provide evidence .
It seems that the above proceedings before ORG are still pending .
